### Create some training datasets

```{r}
diam1 <- diamonds %>% sample_n(3000)

diam3 <- diamonds %>% sample_n(3000)
```

```{r}

```

```{r}

```

```{r}
randomForest(cut ~. , data=diam1)
```


diamRF1 <- randomForest(cut ~. , data=diam1)

predict(diamRF1,diam2)
